displayAddress: CLASS E PERIOD VILLAGE SHOP FOR SALE – BLETCHINGLEY HIGH STREET
detailedDescription: DIRECTIONS Proceeding eastwards out of Redhill town centre along the A25 through South Nutfield and into Bletchingley, the property is at the end of the High Street fronting St Mary’s Church and opposite the Whyte Harte Hotel. LOCATION A prominent and picturesque location on the northern side of Bletchingley High Street with return frontage to Church Walk. The wide main road is full of listed buildings and the corner position exposes the property to prominent view. Redhill town centre and mainline station are about three miles to the west, and access onto the M25 north of Godstone (junction 6) is about two miles by road. DESCRIPTION An attractive Grade II listed corner building comprising a two storey end terrace brick and tiled shop with tile hung and rendered elevations. There is internal and external access to the first floor from a street door along the side elevation. Gas central heating is installed and the showroom has period features eg exposed beams. ACCOMMODATION (all measurements approximate) Ground floor: Front showroom: 15’7” x 14’5” plus front bay window display 8’7” x 2’7”. Log burner. Laminate flooring Beamed ceiling 247 sq ft Back showroom: 10’11” x 7’10”. Part glazed screen. 86 sq ft Inner hall with understairs storage area. Lobby on two levels and side door. Rear kitchen/staffroom: 9’6” x 15’. Double aspect. Sink and wall mounted boiler. 147 sq ft Door to yard with rear gate. First floor: Wide loading on two levels. Front room: 15’10” x 15’2” excluding angled front bay. 240 sq ft Bathroom: Panelled bath with shower attachment and screen, pedestal wash basin & WC Central rom: 10’8” x 10’3”. Door to:- 109 sq ft Rear room: 10’9” x 8’6” 91 sq ft NET INTERNAL FLOOR AREA 920 sq ft (85.47m²) RATING RV £6,300 @UBR 51.2p in the £ 2024/2025. PLANNING The permitted class E use covers shops, offices, clinic, health centres and day nurseries. The property is a Grade II listed building in a designated conservation area. It traded as an antique lighting business, with residential accommodation upstairs, for over 30 years from the mid 1970s. It has been used since 2009 as a party shop by a private and corporate events company. PRICE GUIDE Freehold region £425,000. Vacant possession on completion. VIEWING By prior appointment with our office. Tel: 01737 245886 (ref MS).

displayAddress: REIGATE TOWN CENTRE INVESTMENT – SHOP AND TWO FLOOR MAISONETTE
detailedDescription: LOCATION The premises occupy a prime town centre trading location adjoining the old Market Hall building on the northern side of Reigate High Street with the pedestrianised Castle Walk and Castle Grounds at the rear. Nearby multiple traders include WH Smith, Sweatty Betty, Mountain Warehouse, Pret a Manger, Waterstones and Oliver Bonas. The pedestrian walkway to Morrisons supermarket with parking for 290 cars is on the south side of the high street (plan overleaf). Access onto the M25 at the top of Reigate Hill (junction 8) is within two miles by road. Gatwick airport is about seven miles to the south. DESCRIPTION The premises comprise a three storey terraced building of brick and tile construction with slate roofed back additions, having ground floor shop and basement and separate front entrance to a two bedroomed maisonette on first and second floors. The shop has been fitted out to a good standard with air conditioning and internal staircase to lower floor and the maisonette has gas central heating. There is a metal fire escape at the rear of the maisonette at first floor level and brick steps from the shop leading up to a small area of rear garden. The shop has an EPC rating of C valid until November 2032 and the maisonette an EPC rating of E valid until May 2029. ACCOMMODATION All measurements approximate, the accommodation is arranged as follows:- Shop (16) Internal frontage about 14’3” Built depth about 47 ft Twin window displays Central entrance 47 sq ft Retail area: 14’8” x 20’3” Understairs storage 254 sq ft Rear room: Max 8’8” x 15’7”. Carpeted. 85 sq ft Internal staircase down to lower ground floor:- Kitchen (rear): Max 8’6” x 13’10” 98 sq ft Central store: 13’2” x 12’9” 168 sq ft Front store: 12’ x 12’9”. Meters 151 sq ft NET INTERNAL AREA 803 sq ft (74.6m²) Maisonette (16A) Front door off entrance lobby and stairs leading up to first floor and to split level landing. Living room (front): 14’6” x 12’11” plus angled bay. Kitchen/breakfast room (back): 8’9” x 13’2”. Range of fitted drawers & cupboards, dishwasher, double oven, hob and fridge. Rear landing off which: Laundry room: 5’6” x 9’6”. Wall mounted central heating boiler. Autowasher and dryer. Bathroom: Panelled bath with tiled surround, shower attachment and pedestal washbasin. Separate WC. Second floor landing with airing cupboard. Bedroom 1 (front): 14’5” x 13’4” Bedroom 2 (back): 8’8” x 13’1” RATING Shop – RV £18,750 UBR 51.2 p in the £ 2024/2025 Council tax (maisonette): Band C. Reigate & Banstead Borough Council Tel: 01737 276000. LEASE The shop is let to The Reigate Eye Studio on a ten year lease from 30th June 2021 inside the Landlord and Tenant Act 1954 at £23,000 per annum exclusive. The lease is on FRI terms with rent review and tenant break clause after five years. Maisonette 16A is let on an Assured Shorthold Tenancy until 1st May 2026 at £1,000 per month exclusive. PLANNING The permitted use is class E. The property lies within the town centre conservation area but is not a listed building. PRICE GUIDE Offers in the region of £605,000 freehold. VIEWING By prior appointment with our office. Tel: 01737 245886 (ref MS).

displayAddress: WOODHATCH, REIGATE – MIXED USE INVESTMENT FOR SALE ~ SHOP ON LEASE PLUS TWO FLATS AND REAR GARAGE
detailedDescription: DIRECTIONS Proceeding southwards out of Reigate town centre up Bell Street (A217) and over the brow of Cockshot Hill proceed down to the Woodhatch traffic lights. Turn right into Prices Lane and the turning into the Western Parade service road is about 100 yards on the right hand side. LOCATION Western Parade is one of several shopping parades about one mile to the south of Reigate town centre at the junction of the A217 and Prices Lane. The shops comprise a neighbourhood centre serving a built up residential locality. Gatwick Airport is about six miles to the south and access onto the M25 at the top of Reigate Hill (junction 8) is about three miles by road. DESCRIPTION The property is an inter-war three storey brick and tile terrace building. It comprises a ground floor barbers shop held on lease with rear parking and garage and first and second floor flats (10A and 10B) with shared street entrance and common staircase which also serves the two flats above the jewellers at No 9. The building is fronted by a service road with parking bays and there is a rear access road off which is a parking yard for No 10 and a separate garage. The building and yard together with the separate garage are edged red on the attached Land Registry plan. ACCOMMODATION The ground floor comprises a purpose built lock-up shop of about 498 sq ft of which the retail area – currently a hairdressing salon – is about 375 sq ft with rear kitchen, office and WC. The rear yard has staff parking for four cars in tandem plus a separate brick garage with corrugated roof in the nearby block. The first floor flat (10A) has electric heating and partial double glazing with reception room 10’ x max 14’6”, hallway, kitchen 8’3” x 8’10”, balcony, front bedroom average 8’2” x 11’10”, rear bedroom 6’11” x 11’5” and rear bathroom with wash basin, panelled bath and WC. EPC band D. The second floor flat (10B) is of similar dimensions with gas central heating and original amenities. EPC band E. RATING RV £6,300 UBR 51.2p in the £ 2022/2023. Reigate & Banstead Borough Council Tel: 01737 276691 (business rates). The council tax bands for flats 10A and 10B are B. PLANNING The shop has long been used for retail purposes and falls within class E which since September 2020 embraces retail, offices, medical and health, restaurant and leisure uses. LEASE & TENANCIES The shop, yard and garage are let to Mr R Reading t/a Razor Room Barbers on a ten year internal repairing and insuring lease from 19th January 2019. There is a rent review at the end of year five and also a tenant break clause at the end of year five on six months prior written notice. The lease is inside the security provisions of the Landlord & Tenant Act 1954 with rights to assign or sub-let the whole but not part of the premises. The rent is £10,000 exclusive and the lessee has been in occupation for about thirteen years. Flat 10A is let to Mr G Angelov at £550 per month and flat 10B to Mrs V Vancheva at £475 per month. Both flats are let on shorthold tenancies and the occupants are holding over from their original agreements. PRICE GUIDE Offers in the region of £475,00 freehold. Subject to existing lease of ground floor shop. The property currently produces a gross income of £22,300 per annum. VIEWING By prior appointment with our office. Tel: 01737 245886 (ref MS).

displayAddress: REDHILL COMMON – FREEHOLD RESTAURANT WITH CAR PARK – FOUR BEDROOM FLAT AND TWO STOREY BRICK OUTBUILDING
detailedDescription: DIRECTIONS Proceeding from Reigate towards Redhill on the A25, turn right at Shaws Corner opposite the Hatch P.H, fork left into Whitepost Hill with Redhill Common on the right, and turn right just before the Garibaldi P.H. Turn right at the T-junction, pass St Johns Church and The Pendleton is a further 200 yards along on the left with the car park beyond. LOCATION The restaurant is on the edge of Redhill Common in the St Johns Conservation Area about one mile to the south of Redhill town centre and mainline station and about two miles to the south east of Reigate. Gatwick Airport is about six miles to the south. DESCRIPTION Run for the past five years as Dexter Burgers, the restaurant has 51 inside covers, 54 outside covers and parking for 15 cars. The restaurant includes handmade bar counters, shelves and display fridges, a kitchen fully equipped with stoves, ovens and bench fridges and separate gents’ and ladies’ toilets. Dexter Burgers are on a rolling agreement and are looking to re-locate. The upstairs flat is centrally heated and has four bedrooms, living room, kitchen/breakfast room, utility room, shower room/WC and separate WC. The two storey brick outbuilding has good storage on the ground floor and offices/stores on the first floor. Lobby with steps to rear door and to modern ladies and gents toilets. Modern fully equipped kitchen: Avg 23’3” x 11’. Modern steel equipment with three phase electricity. Two 6 grid Rational Combi ovens, chip fryer, two double plancha and single hob Athanor Range, worktops, shelves and racking, sinks and two bench fridges. NET AREA APPROX 1,270 SQ FT (118m²) Flat Staircase and door from rear restaurant lobby. Wide landing with understairs cupboard. Lounge (front): 11’2” x 11’1” plus study recess 4’10” x 4’10” Kitchen/Breakfast room (front): 12’10” x 11’11”, Matching units with worksurfaces, sink, hob, cooker hood, oven and microwave and American fridge/freezer. Bedroom One (rear): max 13’ x 12’ Bedroom Two (rear): 11’1” x 9’8” Lobby to separate utility room and shower room/WC. Carpeted staircase to second floor with landing Velux window. Bedroom Three (rear): 12’6” x 11’5”. Two eaves cupboards. Bedroom Four (rear): 11’7” x 9’11”. Two eaves cupboards. Outbuilding Two storey brick and slate attached building with high fencing and gate to road, cobbled forecourt, service and refuse area and raised concrete section. Both floors have headroom of 8ft plus and there is a rear metal staircase to the upper floor. Ground floor front store: 13’7” x 17’8” Ground floor refrigeration area: Avg 13’10” x 11’8”. Walk in fridge, two meat chillers and one freezer. First floor office/store: 14’1” x 30’3”. Either side of the restaurant is further seating in the forecourt area, which has access to a cellar (also access from inside). Steps with shrubs and gravel area lead down to a rear garden area with seating backing onto a wooded copse. The tarmac car park has 15 spaces. RATING RV £17,300 UBR 51.2p in the £ 2021/2023. Reigate & Banstead Borough Council Tel: 01737 276691. PRICE GUIDE £825,000 plus VAT. Freehold. To include fittings and equipment. VIEWING By prior appointment with our office. displayAddress: DORKING – DETACHED BUILDING APPROX 2500 SQ FT – F1 USE CLASS – WORSHIP/EDUCATION – PRICE GUIDE £450,000 FREEHOLD

displayAddress: FREEHOLD VACANT SHOP FOR SALE IN WATERHOUSE LANE, KINGSWOOD – APPROX 549 SQ FT WITH 256 SQ FT CELLAR
detailedDescription: DIRECTIONS Proceed up Reigate Hill and along the A217 through Lower Kingswood. Turn right at the Tadworth roundabout signposted Kingswood into Bonsor Drive (B2032). Turn left at the Kingswood Arms P.H. in the village and the premises are about 100 yards on the right. LOCATION The premises form part of the local shopping parade in Kingswood fronting Waterhouse Lane and opposite open land. The main A217 Brighton Road is within half a mile. Kingswood station is a short walk. Kingswood is an affluent area with the nearest town centres of Epsom, Sutton and Reigate each within five miles. Access onto the M25 at the top of Reigate Hill (junction 8) is under four miles to the south. DESCRIPTION The unit being offered for sale is the front section of premises which have been used for the last ten years as a hair and beauty salon. It is a part of a three storey inter-war parade of shops and flats and comprises a front reception area behind which is a central lobby and four partitioned treatment rooms one of which has a trap door access to a useful cellar. The unit is well presented with modern wiring, inset lighting, matching flooring and decorative coving and there are hand basins in each of the treatment rooms. The reception area has full height window display and air conditioning/heating unit. The owners have prior approval from the council to build a one bedroom flat attached to the rear of the shop. They will install a new rear cavity wall with full sound insulation and will leave the purchaser to install a toilet and reinstate as necessary the door to the side path which is currently blocked off. The attached layout plan shows the new shop area shaded green and the flat shaded brown. ACCOMMODATION All measurements approximate, the accommodation comprises: Front retail area: 18’8” x 13’ Central lobby: 3’2” x 17’4” Treatment room (left central): 8’x ‘4” Treatment room (left rear): 5’10” x 7’8” – excludes shower unit Treatment room (right central): 7’1” x 9’1” Treatment room (right rear): 7’9” x 8’2” NET INTERNAL AREA 549 SQ FT (51m²) Cellar: 15’9” x 16’. 7’6” headroom (252 sq ft) RATING Rateable value to be reassessed following alterations UBR 51.2 p in the £ 2021/2022. PRICE Region of £140,000 FREEHOLD VIEWING By prior appointment with our office. Tel: 01737 245886 (until 1pm weekdays).

displayAddress: Subud Hall, Allingham Road, Reigate, Surrey RH2 8HX – Detached F1 Building For Sale
detailedDescription: DIRECTIONS Proceed southwards out of Reigate town centre up the A217 Bell Street, turn right at the brow of Cockshot Hill into Park Lane East, take the third turning on the left into Church Road, then right into Allingham Road and the property is on the left just before the Cooperative store. LOCATION The premises are located in the South Park area of Reigate a little over 1 mile to the south of the town centre in a built up area comprising mainly older style residential property (see plan overleaf). Allingham Road is a relatively narrow street with limited although unrestricted parking. Gatwick airport is about 6 miles to the south and junction 8 of the M25 at the top of Reigate Hill is about 3 miles to the north. DESCRIPTION Built as a church in the 1890s with 2 main halls and later additions, the property comprises 4 inter-communicating single storey brick structures with differing roof heights and types. The main buildings are 2 pitched roofed halls at the front and rear and these are linked by a central flat roof section used as a reception area and open plan kitchen. There is also a post-war single storey flat roofed brick addition comprising toilet accommodation in the south east corner. Both front and rear halls connect to separate gents and ladies toilets. The premises are currently in use for weekend worship.The site is broadly level with road frontage of about 42 ft widening to about 80 ft at the rear, with maximum site depth of 188 sq ft in all about 0.25 acre (0.1 hectare). There is currently no onsite parking provision. The minimum gap down the western side of the building is about nine feet. ACCOMMODATION The accommodation is arranged as follows; all measurements approximate:- Front entrance porch: 6’10” x 4’7” 31 sq ft Front hall: 25’3” x 50’2” – 11’ headroom 1267 sq ft Lobby with separate gents & ladies toilets — Side vestibule: 4’6” x 5’7” 25 sq ft Reception area/kitchen: 35’ x 11’10” 415 sq ft Rear hall: 41’ x 24’ – 11ft headroom 984 sq ft Separate gents & ladies toilets — NET INTERNAL FLOOR AREA 2722 sq ft (253.44m²) Front forecourt with concrete paving and grassed area. Side path to steel ramp into entrance vestibule. Timber gate and screen through to rear garden which is mainly lawned with paving and three small timber sheds. RATING RV: none listed. UBR 51.2p in the £ 2024/2025. PLANNING The permitted planning use is F1 ie places of worship, schools and education. The owners are seeking unconditional offers which are not subject to planning permission for change of use, eg clinics, day nurseries or creches. Planning permission for demolition and replacement by two semi-detached houses was refused in November 2021 under ref 21/00679/OUT. An appeal against the refusal under ref APP/L3625/W/21/3288783 was dismissed on 9th December 2022, the main reason being the loss of a non-designated heritage asset. PRICE GUIDE Offers in the region of £450,000. Freehold. Vacant possession. VIEWING Strictly by prior appointment with our office. Tel: 01737 245886 (ref MS).

displayAddress: 73 HIGH STREET, REIGATE – GROUND FLOOR LOCK-UP SHOP PREMISES – APPROX 667 SQ FT
detailedDescription: LOCATION The property is located on the south side of Reigate High Street at its western end and close to Marks & Spencer Food Store, Morrisons Supermarket and Priory Park (see plan overleaf). The premises are about 600 yards from Reigate station, within 100 yards of the Nutley Lane public car park, and about 2 miles from access onto the M25 at the top of Reigate Hill (Junction 8). Gatwick Airport is about 7 miles to the south. DESCRIPTION The premises are between Fortanini and Gurkha Kitchen comprise a ground floor lock up shop in a 3 storey mid terrace building of rendered brick construction under a pitch tiled roof. The upper maisonette at 73a has been sold off on long lease and has separate access from the rear service road off Park Lane. The shop has full height window display with matching flooring throughout, false ceiling with spotlights and air conditioning cooler/heater in the main retail area. The EPC rating is band C. Main services other than gas are connected. There is no parking with the premises but the Nutley Lane car park is a short distance to the north. ACCOMMODATION The accommodation is arranged as follows, all measurements approximate:- Front Shop: 14’4” x 32’ 4” Full height window display. Full ceiling with inset lighting, AC unit and headroom approx. 8ft 463 sq ft Back shop area: 6’4” x 10’8” with under stairs cupboard widening To 8’11” x 8’10” with fire exit door 153 sq ft Rear lobby with door to cloakroom & separate WC at rear and door to: Rear office/showroom: 5’8” x 9’ 51 sq ft Total: 667 sq ft NET INTERNAL AREA 667 SQ FT (62.22 m²) RATING RV £14,250 UBR 51.2p in the £ 2024/2025 Reigate & Banstead Borough Council Tel: 01737 276691. NB The premises may qualify for small business rates relief and the local authority will be able to advise individual applicants. LEASE TERMS 10 year IRI lease inside Landlord and Tenant Act 1954 at £18,500 per annum exclusive with rent review end of year five. PLANNING Under the Class E category introduced in September 2020 the premises may be used for retail, offices, café, medical/health or day nursery. LEGAL COSTS Each side to be responsible for its own legal costs in the transaction. VIEWING By prior appointment with our office. Tel: 01737 245886 (ref MS)

displayAddress: CLASS E SHOP PREMISES ~ REAR PARKING FOR 3 CARS ~ TO LET ON NEW LEASE ~ £49,500 PER ANNUM
detailedDescription: LOCATION The premises are located on the south side of the High Street opposite the town centre traffic lights close to multiple retailers including WH Smith, Sweaty Betty, Mountain Warehouse, Pret a Manger, Waterstones and Oliver Bonas. The property backs onto the Morrisons town centre store with 390 parking spaces. Access onto the M25 at the top of Reigate Hill (junction 8) is about 1½ miles by road. Gatwick Airport is some 7 miles to the south. DESCRIPTION Arranged over 3 storeys behind a double fronted shop window and with loading bay outside the premises the property comprises a Grade II listed building with beamed interior and has rear access from Bell Street leading to a garage and 2 parking spaces. ACCOMMODATION The accommodation is arranged as follows (all measurements approximate):- Front retail area: 17’10” widening to 23’ x 31’3”. Headroom 12ft plus. – 640 sq ft Rear retail area: 9’7” x 4’8” down to 18’ x 15’8” including 2 partitioned – 327 sq ft changing rooms. Kitchen: 6’2” x 8’9” small yard & WC – 55 sq ft Basement: 8’ x 16” plus 14’10” x 5’6” – 210 sq ft First floor: raised balcony/mezzanine with retail areas 10’2” x 6’11” and 19’ x 15’9” with two changing rooms – 369 sq ft Second floor stores of 483 sq ft plus office 13’8” x 13’3” – 663 sq ft TOTAL NET AREA about 2264 sq ft (210.33m²) Brick yard with space for 3 cars Single storey garage – 16’6” x 11’6” RATING Rateable value £41,000. UBR 51.2 p in the £ 2023/2024. Reigate & Banstead Borough Council Tel: 01737 276691. PLANNING The property has class E use which includes retail, restaurant, financial and professional services, clinic & health care. LEASE New 10 year FRI lease inside the Landlord & Tenant Act 1954 with 5 year rent review. RENT £49,500 per annum exclusive. LEGAL COSTS Each party to pay own legal costs in the transaction. VIEWING By prior appointment with Crow Watkin. Tel: 01737 245886 (office hours 9am – 1pm)

displayAddress: EXTENSIVE RESTAURANT PREMISES WITH STAFF FLAT ~ 136 INTERNAL COVERS ~ HIGH STREET POSITION
detailedDescription: LOCATION Three intercommunicating listed buildings in a picturesque terrace located on the northern side of the High Street between Marks & Spencer Food Hall and the pedestrian entrance to Morrisons supermarket on the other side of the road. The premises are close to various multiple retailers and the major attraction of Reigate Priory park. The Nutley Lane public car park is about 150 yds, Reigate Station about 600 yds and access onto the M25 at the top of Reigate Hill about two miles. DESCRIPTIONS The premises comprise an attractive terrace of period properties with white and tile hung elevations under various sections of pitch tiled roofing with dormer windows and two small roofed areas at the rear. The rectangular shaped site has road frontage of about 78ft and maximum site depth of about 133ft. The ground level rises to the rear where there is a large paved outside seating area behind the building and a further set of steps up to a rear garden which has a gate to the castle grounds. There is access to a separate flat (known as 46 Castle Walk) at the eastern end of the site. In common with other shops on the north side of the High Street there is no vehicular access at the rear, so loading is from the High Street. ACCOMMODATION The accommodation is arranged on three floors excluding cellar storage of about 630ft2. The ground floor has four intercommunicating restaurant areas at the front totalling about 1,378ft2 with cloakrooms, kitchens and ancillary accommodation of about 500ft2. The first-floor accommodation comprises a panelled restaurant area of about 640ft2 with pastry kitchen, two staff toilets, office, dry store and staff room – about 581ft2. There are second floor attics of about 237ft2. There are about 45 spaces outside with heaters. There is a separate flat approached from the rear only comprising large open plan lounge diner, long hall, three rooms, kitchen/breakfast room, bathroom and W.C. The flat has been pleasantly modernised. Improvements in recent years include overhaul of roof, frontage windows and re-rendering and redecoration of the front facades. New lighting was installed, replacement floor coverings, some replumbing of the ground floor and overhaul of the extraction system and new toilets. There was significant expenditure on an enlarged kitchen facility. PLANNING The property is a Grade II listed building within the town centre conservation area. It has a long-established use for restaurant use which commenced in the late 1990’s as ASK Pizza. RATING RV £66,500. UBR 51.2p in the £. April 2023. Subject to business rates relief as appropriate. Reigate & Banstead Borough Council Tel: 01737 276691 (Commercial Rates department). LEASE The former FRI Lease expiring in October 2028 is at £87,000 per annum exclusive + VAT and no further review. Alternatively, a new agreement can be entered into by negotiation. LEGAL COSTS Each side to be responsible for its own legal costs in the transaction. VIEWING By arrangement with the sole agents. Tel: 01737 245886 (ref MS).

displayAddress: CROMWELL ROAD, REDHILL – NEW GROUND FLOOR COMMERCIAL SPACE – TO BE LET AS ONE OVERALL UNIT OR TWO SEPARATE UNITS – APPROX 4138 SQ FT WITH FOUR PARKING SPACES
detailedDescription: LOCATION Cromwell Road is a two way street in Redhill town centre between Station Road and the pedestrianised High Street. It is close to the traffic lights at the rear exit of the Belfry Shopping Centre and has good visibility to traffic from either direction . The local council’s major new mixed use scheme, Marketfield Way, is scheduled for completion later in 2022. This will include 150 new homes and there are other large residential schemes within walking distance, eg Picture House, the Quadrant building close to Redhill Station and Brook Road to the south. DESCRIPTION These four ground floor commercial units are part of a new five storey scheme (Wheatley Court) which includes four stories of flats (32 units) with passenger lifts. The ground floor units will have four undercroft parking spaces and will be fitted out to shell with recessed entrances and two automatic front doors. Shops 16 & 18 have 14’8” headroom and 20 & 22 have 13’11” headroom. The scheme has been designed as one large commercial space but could be divided into two units with the following approximate sizes:- No 16 975 sq ft 90.58m² Nos 16 & 18 No 18 1008 sq ft 93.65m² 1983 sq ft No 20 909 sq ft 84.45m² No 22 1246 sq ft 115.76m² Nos 20 & 22 4138 sq ft 384.44m² 2155 sq ft PLANNING Planning permission was granted for this scheme by Reigate & Banstead Borough Council on 6th September 2018 under ref 18/01158/F permitted use of the ground floor space for a variety of purposes including A1 retail, A2 financial and professional services, D1 medical & health and D2 gyms. Since the government’s introduction of new use classes in September 2020, class E now embraces a broad range of commercial, business and service activities/purposes including restaurants but excludes takeaways which now classify as sui generis. Preference will be given to fitness, medical, office & retail users rather than restaurants or takeaways in view of potential issues with opening hours noise & ventilation affecting the flats above. RATING Rateable Values yet to be assessed. LEASE TERMS Ten year lease with five year rent review inside the Landlord & Tenant Act 1954. LEGAL COSTS Each side to be responsible for its own legal costs in the transaction. RENT £49,500 per annum exclusive. VIEWING By prior appointment with our office. Tel: 01737 245886 (ref MS).
